poem:
Title: In the Unearthed Depths

In the murk of practiced deceit,
Along the marred corridors of power,
A call echoes, staunch - despite defeat.

Peer, campaigner, stalwart tower,
Demands inquiry, casts his letter,
To the auditing sower.

From the scandal's ashes, a plea for better,
Saudi bribes - arms trading's sinister binder,
Prompting truth's untiring go-getter.

Petition for probing this malign reminder,
Justice thirsts, long after the crime,
In green field or desert, no scandal is kinder.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Peter Hain calls for inquiry into MoD’s alleged role in Saudi bribes scandal Alleged Ministry of Defence complicity in the “national scandal” of bribery on arms deals in Saudi Arabia must be investigated by government auditors, a senior Labour politician has said. Peter Hain, the antiapartheid campaigner and peer, said in a letter to the National Audit Office (NAO) that a “timely, targeted” investigation was now necessary after the conclusion of a major criminal trial.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
